metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27843 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in OpenJPEG in versions prior to 2.4.0. This flaw allows an attacker to provide specially crafted input to the conversion or encoding functionality, causing an out-of-bounds read. The highest threat from this vulnerability is system availability.

notes.Note: sahnaseredini> the fix is not complete in bionic as the poc is still working. Also there's a commit in the upstream (07d526e) that is reverting some optimisations and (apparently) fixes the issue, however, it does not relate to the CVE, and looks more like a bug fix.

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
